metadata.Title: CVE-2023-42756 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - high
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Netfilter subsystem of the Linux kernel. A racecondition between IPSET_CMD_ADD and IPSET_CMD_SWAP can lead to a kernelpanic due to the invocation of `__ip_set_put` on a wrong `set`. This issuemay allow a local user to crash the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-42756` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-165-generic - 5.4.0-165.182~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-165-lowlatency - 5.4.0-165.182~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
